title: V26 QUANTUM REALITY: Full overwrite AppV1 with Singularity entry, Hyper-Reality feed, HUD overlays, and Architect creator mode

requirements.text: Completely overwrite `frontend/src/AppV1.jsx` with the exact V26 “QUANTUM REALITY” code provided by the user, treating it as the full app UI implementation.

quotes: INSTRUCTION : Remplace INTÉGRALEMENT le code de `frontend/src/AppV1.jsx`.

acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/AppV1.jsx` content is replaced in full by the user-provided V26 code (not merged into the old V25 code).
The application boots through the existing `frontend/src/App.tsx` wrapper and renders the V26 UI.

requirements.text: Ensure the project compiles and runs after the V26 overwrite by applying only minimal mechanical fixes required for this repository (e.g., missing/incorrect imports, undefined identifiers, invalid JSX), without changing the intended UI layout, styling, copy, or interaction behavior of the provided V26 code.

quotes: appliquer seulement les corrections mécaniques nécessaires pour que l’application compile et fonctionne.

acceptanceCriteria: `npm run build` (or equivalent CI build) succeeds without TypeScript/ESLint blocking errors introduced by the pasted code.
All referenced symbols in `AppV1.jsx` resolve (e.g., any dataset constant used to initialize state such as `INITIAL_SALONS` is defined consistently with the provided `DATA`).
No changes are made to immutable frontend entry files; `frontend/src/App.tsx` remains a thin wrapper rendering `AppV1`.

requirements.text: Implement/verify the V26 “Singularity Entry” experience: a black entry screen with a pulsing orb that requires a sustained press (mouse or touch) to enter, and triggers an “aspiration” transition when entry completes.

quotes: 1. L'ENTRÉE "SINGULARITÉ" : Un écran noir avec un orbe pulsant au centre. Il faut Maintenir le clic (Long Press) pour entrer. L'écran "aspire" l'utilisateur.

acceptanceCriteria: On desktop: holding mouse down charges progress; releasing early resets progress to 0.
On mobile: holding touch charges progress; releasing early resets progress to 0.
When progress reaches 100%, the UI transitions into the next view with a clear ‘aspiration’/pull-in animation (not an abrupt cut).

requirements.text: Implement/verify the V26 “Hyper-Reality Feed” behavior: salons render as full-screen windows, scrolling between them uses spring-like motion, and images subtly zoom in response to scroll progression.

quotes: 2. FEED "HYPER-REALITY" : Les salons sont des fenêtres plein écran. Le passage de l'un à l'autre utilise une physique de "ressort" (Spring Physics). Les images zooment légèrement quand on scrolle.

acceptanceCriteria: In the client feed, each salon card occupies a full viewport presentation (one salon per screen, scroll to advance).
Transitions/scroll between items feel spring-based (Framer Motion spring config is used for the primary movement).
As the user scrolls through the feed, the active salon image applies a slight zoom effect tied to scroll (not just hover).

requirements.text: Implement/verify the V26 HUD (Heads-Up Display) overlays: floating bio/price/contact surfaces are presented as frosted-glass panels and visually react on hover (desktop) while remaining usable on touch devices.

quotes: 3. INTERFACE "HUD" (HEADS-UP DISPLAY) : Les informations (Bio, Prix, Contact) flottent sur des panneaux de verre givré qui réagissent au survol.

acceptanceCriteria: HUD information panels use a frosted-glass style (backdrop blur + translucent fill + subtle border).
On hover-capable devices, panels show a noticeable hover reaction (e.g., opacity/brightness/border accent/blur shift).
On touch devices, the HUD remains readable and does not require hover to access essential info.

requirements.text: Implement/verify the V26 Architect Mode (Creator) requirements: cyber-futuristic creator UI with a real-time revenue simulator that increases as services are added, and a “Dimension” switch to instantly toggle Setup ↔ Preview.

quotes:
4. ARCHITECT MODE (CRÉATEUR) : Une interface cyber-futuriste.
    * Simulateur de Revenus : Une jauge qui monte quand on ajoute des services.
    * Switch "Dimension" : Un bouton pour passer du mode "Setup" au mode "Preview" instantanément.

acceptanceCriteria: Revenue simulation updates immediately when services are added/edited (no manual refresh).
A visible Setup/Preview toggle exists and switches instantly between editing and previewing the created salon experience.
Publishing/finishing the creator flow injects the new salon into the in-memory salon list immediately (local-only demo behavior; no backend calls).

constraints: Do not modify any frontend immutable entry files (including `frontend/src/main.tsx` and the Internet Identity hooks).
Keep `frontend/src/App.tsx` as the thin wrapper that renders `AppV1`.
No backend changes are required for V26; keep the app strictly local-state/demo as implied by the provided code.
nonGoals: Re-introducing Internet Identity authentication or role-based routing in V26.
Connecting V26 UI to Motoko backend APIs (salons CRUD, bookings persistence, on-chain image upload, React Query data loading).
Implementing real-time server push, sockets, or any backend-driven live updates.
